qa_pairs.question: What is Rocio Perez's professional background?
qa_pairs.answer: Rocio Perez has been working in education for the last 13 years in various capacities and is now starting a career path in counseling at the high school level.
qa_pairs.source_text: I work in education Ive been working in education for the last 13 years in various capacities recently graduated and will be starting an actual like going into my career path as counseling or within that realm of work at the high school level

qa_pairs.question: What artistic mediums does Rocio Perez work with?
qa_pairs.answer: Rocio Perez works with various mediums, focusing more recently on photography, both film and digital, and also engages in painting and creating merchandise and clothing.
qa_pairs.source_text: I work with a lot of different mediums uh more recently Ive been working with more of like the photography aspect but I do a lot of painting I also like create like merch and clothing but like I said Ive been honing in a lot more on photography and focusing mainly on film as well as digital

qa_pairs.question: What inspires Rocio Perez's artistic work?
qa_pairs.answer: Rocio Perez is inspired by everything around her, including where she grew up and the diverse individuals she has been around. She aims to capture a nostalgic feeling of San Francisco in her photography.
qa_pairs.source_text: a lot of my work is just really Im inspired by everything around me like where I grew up like who Ive been around like Ive been blessed to be around like a lot of like diverse individuals Growing Up So culture to me like resonates a lot and being able to like show like a nostalgic feeling of San Francisco or like old Frisco is what I would say is like something that I really like to capture when I do photography

qa_pairs.question: How does Rocio Perez describe her housing experience?
qa_pairs.answer: Rocio Perez feels fortunate not to have faced a challenging struggle with housing, attributing this to her mother's background and success. However, she has witnessed shifts and displacement among friends and family.
qa_pairs.source_text: for me personally like my housing story I feel like its always been a little bit um I feel like its always been a little bit different in comparison to whether its people I grew up with or my family like Ive been fortunate enough to not like have this like challenging struggle with housing and it comes from like my moms like background and like the work she put in and like being able to like work and be successful but I have seen a lot of shifts with housing within like friends within my immediate family Ive seen a lot of displacement

qa_pairs.question: What is Rocio Perez's current housing situation?
qa_pairs.answer: Rocio Perez lives in her family's home, renting it at a rate below market value, thanks to her mother's decision to charge only enough to cover the mortgage.
qa_pairs.source_text: I do live in a home right now its my familys home but I rent to them Im not paying market value I have friends that live with me and my mom was like Im not going to charge you guys market value like I want to make it fair because its crazy out there so shes like as long as the mortgage is being paid Ill like charge you guys like the cheapest rent

qa_pairs.question: What challenges does Rocio Perez identify regarding affordable housing in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: Rocio Perez highlights the high income required to afford housing in San Francisco, the displacement of friends, and the lack of accessible affordable housing despite new developments.
qa_pairs.source_text: I feel like affordable like its also it comes down to like the big gap theres gaps like with like income like the numbers are crazy like what you have to be making in San Francisco to afford to be known as like the median is adult its like its so mind-blowing to me and like like I said I work in education so a lot of families that I work with are more marginalized communities low income and I see like multiple families living in like one or two bedrooms and its not that theyre not working theyre all working theyre all busting their asses but its just very challenging to be like me like what that minimum is and like I feel like this I feel like the average salary here to be successful and actually pay rent you have to be making at least over 85 to 100K

qa_pairs.question: What concerns does Rocio Perez have about new housing developments in her neighborhood?
qa_pairs.answer: Rocio Perez is concerned about whether new housing developments in her neighborhood will be affordable for current residents, despite the construction of new units.
qa_pairs.source_text: right now right by me off the ocean theres three different properties going up theres about to be almost 275 units and my question is like oh thats cool because its a very residential family oriented neighborhood still but like are these individuals going to be able to afford whats like being placed there

qa_pairs.question: How does Rocio Perez view the impact of housing on marginalized communities in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: Rocio Perez believes that marginalized communities, particularly black and brown folks or newcomers, are the most vulnerable and often pushed to the side, lacking access to essential services and resources.
qa_pairs.source_text: I would have to say like the most vulnerable is always like the most marginalized communities and it tends to be like more of black and brown folks or people of color newcomers coming from different countries

qa_pairs.question: What are some of the barriers faced by marginalized communities in San Francisco according to Rocio Perez?
qa_pairs.answer: Rocio Perez notes that marginalized communities face barriers such as lack of access to grocery stores, transportation, and schools, impacting their daily lives and routines.
qa_pairs.source_text: marginalized communities definitely get pushed to the side and you can kind of notice it when you map out San Francisco and you see what they have access to like for example like if we look at the Bay View like Hunters Point like thats like kind of push to the skirts you dont really have many grocery stores around there so its like lack of access to Transportation like you have transportation but its like you dont have Bart nearby a lot of the schools arent there so everyone communion has to commute at least an hour

qa_pairs.question: What does Rocio Perez think about the distribution of resources in San Francisco neighborhoods?
qa_pairs.answer: Rocio Perez observes that some neighborhoods like Noe Valley have ample resources and access, while others, despite being central, still face barriers.
qa_pairs.source_text: I feel like Noe Valley always comes to mind I feel like its a quaint neighborhood like close to everything like in the mix but still to the side and its like it has a lot of resources available around them public transportation theres several schools
